Prompt: For John Stuart Mill, what is the “peculiar evil of silencing the expression of an opinion,” however unpopular, and on what grounds would Mill permit society to restrict individual liberty?

John Stuart Mill argues that silencing an opposing view is a mistake because it may subdue a better alternative or prevent the reinforcement of the superior option. He feels that society should be able to restrict an individual’s liberty when it disrespects the rights of others or causes injury to them.
